snippet: The defendant, Michael Dunn, has said he acted in self-defense when he fatally shot Jordan Davis, 17, of Marietta, Ga., in November 2012 outside a Jacksonville convenience store.
abstract: Character witnesses for Michael Dunn, Florida man who is being tried in the fatal shooting of black teenager Jordan Davis, say they never knew him to be violent; testimony comes as prosecutors rest their case in the first-degree murder trial.
lead_paragraph: The defendant, Michael Dunn, has said he acted in self-defense when he fatally shot Jordan Davis, 17, of Marietta, Ga., in November 2012 outside a Jacksonville convenience store.

headline.main: Man in Murder Case Called Nonviolent
headline.print_headline: Man in Murder Case Called Nonviolent
